newsitem.title: UK: Eurotunnel says to unveil jobs cuts Tuesday.
newsitem.headline: Eurotunnel says to unveil jobs cuts Tuesday.

text.p: Channel tunnel operator Eurotunnel Plc/SA said on Monday it would announce details of several hundred job losses on Tuesday.
A spokeswoman told Reuters that reports the company was to shed 657 staff out of a total of more than 3,500 employees were "broadly correct."
She said job cuts would primarily affect temporary, part-time and fixed-term contract staff in the U.K. and France, and added that "full-time workers will be redeployed" where possible.
Details of the plans are to be put to a staff works council meeting in Calais, and the company will also make a public announcment about the cuts on Tuesday.

The heavily-indebted company, which has succeeded in gaining an almost 50 percent share of cross-Channel traffic in its first two years of operation, is under strong pressure from creditor banks to cut costs and break even.
